summary: File browser UI/UX and search improvements: restore file preview-on-click, enable recursive search for files (not just folders), and reposition the current path display above the filesystem list (target div 5yv2go).
architectural_notes: User request constraint: apply minimal changes and avoid altering other functionality to prevent breakage; restore previously working behavior where possible.
known_issues: Known regression: clicking a file does not open preview.
Known limitation/bug: recursive search currently applies to folders only, not files.

existing_features.title: Move the current-path breadcrumb div (the one containing the currently selected breadcrumb button; user referred to it as div "5yv2go") so it renders directly above the filesystem list (files/folders area) and not above the search bar.

Restore file preview-on-click behavior so that clicking a file row reliably opens the preview modal (FilePreviewModal) for that file, as it did in the previous version, without changing unrelated file browser functionality.

Fix subtree search so recursive searching includes files in descendant folders (not just folders), including when searching from the root context, while preserving existing search behavior (case/diacritics-insensitive name matching).
Bump the app version to 0.3.87 anywhere the version is surfaced in code/config (at minimum the frontend appVersion constant and the backend version value if present).

new_feature_requests.summary: Fix regression: file preview does not open when clicking a file (restore previous behavior)
Enable recursive search for files as well as folders (currently only folders)
Move the current-path div (div 5yv2go / containing currently selected button) to sit just above the filesystem list, not above search

projectName: Fix file preview click regression, enable recursive file search, and move current-path breadcrumb above filesystem list (v0.3.87)
